dataset.title: PISCO: Intertidal: MARINe Core Surveys: Photo Plots

address.deliveryPoint: University of California, Santa Cruz, Long Marine Lab
University of California, Santa Cruz, Long Marine Lab
University of California, Santa Cruz, Long Marine Lab

abstract.para: This metadata record documents the Photo Plot Survey data for the Multi-Agency Rocky Intertidal Network (MARINe) Core surveys. These surveys are conducted throughout the year at sites ranging from Northern Oregon to Southern California.

intellectualRights.para: We ask that you contact the MARINe group prior to using this information for any purpose. We make this request to minimize possibilities for misinterpretation of data and to reduce redundancy since we may be currently working on projects that involve this information. Also, we would like to be informed of and involved in projects developed using this information. Please cite MARINe in all publications containing these data. The citation should include the following: 'This study utilized data collected by the Multi-Agency Rocky Intertidal Network'. Please contact the data set owner(s) for additional citation requirements specific to the data being requested. Please note that site coordinates and sensitive species have been removed from all public datasets. For a comprehensive dataset, please contact the data set owner(s). Please send copies of any published manuscript based on these data to the MARINe Program Coordinator (j_engle@lifesci.ucsb.edu) and the PISCO Program Coordinator (http://piscoweb.org/who/coordinators). Where appropriate, researchers whose projects are integrally dependent on MARINe data are encouraged to consider collaboration and/or co-authorship with original MARINe investigators. Extensive efforts are made to ensure that online data are accurate and up to date, but the authors and MARINe will not take responsibility for any errors that may exist in data provided online. Furthermore, the user assumes all responsibility for errors in analysis or judgment resulting from use of the data.

address.deliveryPoint: University of California, Santa Cruz, Long Marine Lab

section.title: Photo Plot Methods - Overview
section.para: Photo Plot sampling is conducted by recording the number of organisms found within a permanent plot at a given site. Rectangular photo plots are photographed in the field, with plots either scored in the field, or in the lab. In general, 5 replicate plots are placed in a stratified random manner throughout the target species' zone of maximum abundance. Algae and invertebrate species counts are recorded. Please note that these data do not reflect all species present in a given area. In addition, the information in this Data Set is limited by the methods described in our survey protocols. Any site specific exceptions to the plot size and number of replicates can be found on the photo plot info table. For more information, see http://www.marine.gov/Research/Protocols.html.

section.title: Photo Plot Methods - Field Scoring
section.para: Photo plots are scored in the field by using a 50 cm X 75 cm frame with a 10 X 10 grid of evenly-spaced string lines. A species, higher taxon, or substrate located below each of the 100 intersection points is identified and recorded. Layering is not scored separately, so the total cover is 100 percent.

section.title: Photo Plot Methods - Lab Scoring
section.para: Photo plots are scored in the lab either from film or digital photographs. For film photographs, each slide is projected onto a white board that is marked with a grid of one hundred evenly-spaced points (10 x 10). A species, higher taxon, or substrate located below each of the 100 intersection points is identified and recorded. When scoring digital images, a grid of one hundred evenly-spaced points (10 x 10) is created on the computer monitor (using Adobe Photoshop), and placed on a separate layer. This allows the scorer to easily remove the dot to see what lies beneath. The image can then be saved with the grid layer, clearly documenting the exact points scored. With either film or digital image scoring, grid size is manipulated to provide complete coverage of the plot within the quadrapod frame. Layering is not scored separately, so the total cover is 100 percent.

funding.para: David and Lucile Packard Foundation, Gordon and Betty Moore Foundation, Minerals Management Service, National Park Service.

dataTable.entityDescription: Lookup table containing a list of sites and site characteristics for the MARINe Core surveys

attribute.attributeDefinition: Six character alphanumeric code which uniquely identifies the site where the intertidal survey was conducted.

textDomain.definition: any letters or numbers in format XXXXXX

attribute.attributeDefinition: The unique letter code for each site that is referenced by the observation tables.
A list of sites where MARINe surveys were conducted along the West Coast of North America. Each site name corresponds to a unique location.

textDomain.definition: The name of the site where the survey was conducted. The description of the location is omitted to protect the locations of sensitive species.

attribute.attributeDefinition: The county in which the site is located.

textDomain.definition: Name of the county as determined by the State in which the site is located.

attribute.attributeDefinition: The name of the island where the referenced site is located. This name includes (but is not limited to) the Channel Islands.

textDomain.definition: Name of the island as determined by the State in which the site is located.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Describes whether the referenced site is located within a Marine Protected Area (MPA) or is a reference site. If this field is blank, the referenced site is not located within an MPA, or is not a reference site for an existing MPA site.

codeDefinition.definition: This site is located within a designated MPA region.
This site is not located within a designated MPA region.

attribute.attributeDefinition: The name of the MPA region where the referenced site is located. If this field is blank, the referenced site is not located within an MPA.

textDomain.definition: Name of the MPA region as identified by the CDFG.
textDomain.source: California Department of Fish and Game (CDFG) http://www.dfg.ca.gov/mlpa

attribute.attributeDefinition: The name of the MPA where the referenced site is located. If this field is blank, the referenced site is not located within an MPA.

textDomain.definition: Name of the MPA as identified by the CDFG.
textDomain.source: California Department of Fish and Game (CDFG) http://www.dfg.ca.gov/mlpa

attribute.attributeDefinition: The name of the National Marine Sanctuary where the referenced site is located. If this field is blank, the referenced site is not located within an NMS.

textDomain.definition: Name of the NMS region as identified by NOAA.
textDomain.source: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) http://sanctuaries.noaa.gov/welcome.html

attribute.attributeDefinition: The name of the Area of Special Biological Significance where the referenced site is located. If this field is blank, the referenced site is not located within an ASBS.

textDomain.definition: Name of the ASBS region as identified by SWRCB.

attribute.attributeDefinition: The name of the National Park region (including, but not limited, to Monuments, Recreation Areas, and Seashores) where the referenced site is located. If this field is blank, the referenced site is not located within a known National Park region.

textDomain.definition: Name of the National Park region as identified by the country where the referenced site is located.

attribute.attributeDefinition: The name of the State or Provincial Park region (including, but not limited to, Recreation Areas, State Beaches, and Tribal Lands) where the referenced site is located. If this field is blank, the referenced site is not located within a known State or Provincial Park region.

textDomain.definition: Name of the State or Provincial Park region as identified by the State or Province where the referenced site is located.

attribute.attributeDefinition: The name of the County Park region (including, but not limited to Preserves and Protected areas) where the referenced site is located. If this field is blank, the referenced site is not located within a known County Park region.

textDomain.definition: Name of the County Park region as identified by the County where the referenced site is located.

attribute.attributeDefinition: The name of the other region (including, but not limited to Ranches, Reserves, Tribal Lands, Military Lands, and Ecological Reserves) where the referenced site is located. If this field is blank, the referenced site is not located within a known other region.

textDomain.definition: Name of the region as identified by the owners of the land where the referenced site is located.

attribute.attributeDefinition: The name of the U.S. County where the referenced site is located. If this field is blank, the referenced site is not located within the United States.

textDomain.definition: Name of the County as as identified by the State where the referenced site is located.

attribute.attributeDefinition: The State or Province and Country where the referenced site is located.

textDomain.definition: Name of the State or Province as determined by the Country in which the site is located.

attribute.attributeDefinition: The number of degrees North of the equator, expressed in decimal degrees to 5 decimal places (NAD83).
The number of degrees West of the Prime Meridian, expressed in decimal degrees to 5 decimal places (NAD83).

The year the site was established. This year is expressed in YYYY format. Dates reflect measurements taken in local time. Local time is Pacific Standard Time except during months when Pacific Daylight Time is effective.

The month that the site was established. This month is expressed in M or MM format. Dates reflect measurements taken in local time. Local time is Pacific Standard Time except during months when Pacific Daylight Time is effective.

The day of the month that the site was established. This date is expressed in D or DD format. Dates reflect measurements taken in local time. Local time is Pacific Standard Time except during months when Pacific Daylight Time is effective.
Used to order the sites geographically along the coast. Actual values are arbitrary, and should not be used for site identification.
Comments specific to each site.

dataTable.entityDescription: Lookup table containing a list of samplers for the MARINe Core Surveys

attribute.attributeDefinition: The unique alphanumeric code for each person that conducted MARINe surveys. This ID is referenced by the observation tables.
The first and last name of the person doing the sampling.
The unique code for each monitoring group that is referenced by the observation tables.
The full name used to identify each monitoring group.
Defines if the group is a group that conducts monitoring or not.

codeDefinition.definition: This group is a monitoring group.
This group is not a monitoring group.

attribute.attributeDefinition: First name of the person doing the sampling.
Middle initial of the person doing the sampling
Last name of the person doing the sampling
Comments regarding the specific sampler.

dataTable.entityDescription: Lookup table containing a list of classifications of organisms or substrate observed in the MARINe Core Surveys

attribute.attributeDefinition: The name of the taxonomic, functional, morphologic, or geologic concept being observed, as it appears in the data taken from the field. This field documents if multiple organisms have been classified with the same name (lumped). This field also documents any name changes (synonyms). Degree of lumping may vary over time and is reflected in the associated Name Convergence field.

textDomain.definition: Name of the organism as identified on ITIS. In cases where substrate or other non taxonomic name is used, classification determined by the survey team.

attribute.attributeDefinition: The unique name that references the taxonomic, functional, morphologic, or geologic concept being observed. This is the current name designation.

textDomain.definition: Name of the organism as identified on ITIS. In cases where substrate or other non taxonomic name is used, classification determined by the survey team.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Defines whether the variable in the Name Convergence column is biological or not

codeDefinition.definition: This is a biological variable.
This is not a biological variable.

attribute.attributeDefinition: One of seven biological categories (such as Plantae or Animalia). This is the broadest resolution of phylogenic identification used in this table.
The major taxonomic group of animals (phylum) and plants (division); contains classes.
A taxonomic group containing one or more orders.
Taxonomic group containing one or more families.
A taxonomic group containing one or more genera.
Taxonomic group containing one or more species.
Taxonomic group whose members can interbreed. This is the most refined level of resolution for phylogenic identification used in this table.
Unique alphabetic lookup code that is referenced by the observation tables.
Six letter code used to lump species together for photo plots across different MARINe survey groups.
Six letter code used to lump species together for transect surveys across different MARINe survey groups.
Defines whether the species observed is a target species. A target species is a species or species group that is targeted by a specific survey protocol.

codeDefinition.definition: This is a target species.
This is not a target species.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Defines whether the species observed is a core species in one or more more of the survey types. A core species is a species or species group that MARINe researchers have agreed to count in each plot or transect.

codeDefinition.definition: This is a core species.
This is not a core species.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Defines whether the species observed is designated as a core species in the photo plot surveys. A core species is a species or species group that MARINe researchers have agreed to count in each plot or transect.

codeDefinition.definition: This is a photo plot core species.
This is not a photo plot core species.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Defines whether the species observed is designated as a core species in the transect surveys. A core species is a species or species group that MARINe researchers have agreed to count in each plot or transect.

codeDefinition.definition: This is a transect core species.
This is not a transect core species.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Defines whether the species observed is designated as a core species in the circular plot surveys. A core species is a species or species group that MARINe researchers have agreed to count in each plot or transect.

codeDefinition.definition: This is a circular plot core species.
This is not a circular plot core species.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Defines whether the species observed is designated as a core species in the abalone or seastar surveys. A core species is a species or species group that MARINe researchers have agreed to count in each plot or transect.

codeDefinition.definition: This is an abalone or seastar core species.
This is not an abalone or seastar core species.

dataTable.entityDescription: Info table regarding MARINe Core survey plots established for the photo plots surveys

attribute.attributeDefinition: The unique code for the monitoring group that surveys the referenced plot at a given site. This code refers to a specific group listed on the personnel table.
The unique letter code that indicates where the plot is located. This ID refers to a specific entry in the site table.
The specific organism that this plot was created to monitor.

textDomain.definition: Name of the organism as identified on ITIS. In cases where substrate or other non taxonomic name is used, classification determined by the survey team.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Replicate plot number, starting from 1.
The area of the plot in square meters (m2).

The year this plot configuration was established. This year is expressed in YYYY format. Dates reflect measurements taken in local time. Local time is Pacific Standard Time except during months when Pacific Daylight Time is effective.

The month this plot configuration was established. This month is expressed in M or MM format. Dates reflect measurements taken in local time. Local time is Pacific Standard Time except during months when Pacific Daylight Time is effective.

The day of the month this plot configuration was established. This date is expressed in D or DD format. Dates reflect measurements taken in local time. Local time is Pacific Standard Time except during months when Pacific Daylight Time is effective.

The last year this configuration was effective. This year is expressed in YYYY format. Dates reflect measurements taken in local time. Local time is Pacific Standard Time except during months when Pacific Daylight Time is effective.

The last month this configuration was effective. This month is expressed in M or MM format. Dates reflect measurements taken in local time. Local time is Pacific Standard Time except during months when Pacific Daylight Time is effective.

The last day of the month that this configuration was effective. This date is expressed in D or DD format. Dates reflect measurements taken in local time. Local time is Pacific Standard Time except during months when Pacific Daylight Time is effective.
Supporting remarks regarding the specific plot being surveyed.

dataTable.entityDescription: Data table for MARINe Core survey observations collected using the Photo Plot method, by coded location and date

attribute.attributeDefinition: The unique code for each monitoring group. This code refers to a specific group listed on the personnel table.
The unique letter code that indicates where the survey was performed. This ID refers to a specific entry in the site table.
Consecutive sampling number. A code created to allow sequencing of the seasons, used for sorting data in chronological order.
A four-character code to identify the Sampling season. The first two characters indicate the season and the last 2 characters indicate the year

The four digit calendar year for this sample season. The sample season is designated by the survey team, and may not indicate the actual survey year. For example, surveys conducted in January, 2008 may have a sample season year of 2007. This year is expressed in YYYY format. Dates reflect measurements taken in local time. Local time is Pacific Standard Time except during months when Pacific Daylight Time is effective.
The Season sequence within each year. Each number indicates a different season.

codeDefinition.definition: Survey conducted in the Spring, generally between February and May
Survey conducted in the Summer, generally between June and September
Survey conducted in the Fall, generally between October and January
Survey conducted in the Winter, generally between December and January. This season is not always used. If it is used, it will overlap Fall and Spring.

attribute.attributeDefinition: The year the observation took place. This year is expressed in YYYY format. Dates reflect measurements taken in local time. Local time is Pacific Standard Time except during months when Pacific Daylight Time is effective.

The month the observation took place. This month is expressed in M or MM format. Dates reflect measurements taken in local time. Local time is Pacific Standard Time except during months when Pacific Daylight Time is effective.

The day of the month that the observation took place. This date is expressed in D or DD format. Dates reflect measurements taken in local time. Local time is Pacific Standard Time except during months when Pacific Daylight Time is effective.
The specific organism that this plot was created to monitor.

textDomain.definition: Name of the organism as identified on ITIS. In cases where substrate or other non taxonomic name is used, classification determined by the survey team.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Replicate plot number, starting from 1.
The unique code that indicates the organism or characteristic being identified. This code refers to a specific entry on the classification table.
The percent cover count of the organism indicated by the Species code (Number of hits of a given species/Total hits all species). Total hits are generally 100.
Used to modify the associated numeric field (counts/percent encountered).

codeDefinition.definition: Estimated
None
Number not available
Not Sampled
percent not based on 100 points
Not Scored

attribute.attributeDefinition: The method used for the plot.

codeDefinition.definition: Field
Lab
Lab - Digitally
Lab - Film
Lab - Slides
Office
